decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing number: 337 PL 115 (Proposed Street Elevation Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023 
Drawing number (Proposed Site Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023 
Drawing No. 337 PL 102 (Proposed Site Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023 
Drawing no. 337 PL 104 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023 
Drawing no. 337 PL 110 (Proposed Front Elevation Plan East) Dated 19-Jun-2023.
Drawing no. 337 PL 116 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Proposed Roof Plan, Proposed Front Elevation A-A Plan, Proposed Section B-B, Proposed Front Garden Bin Store Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023.
Drawing no. 337 PL 105 (Proposed First Floor Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023.
Drawing no. 337 PL 112 (Proposed Rear Elevation Plan West) Dated 19-Jun-2023.  
Drawing no. 337 PL 111 (Proposed Side Elevation Plan North) Dated 19-Jun-2023.    
Drawing no. 337 PL 113(Proposed Side Elevation Plan South) Dated 19-Jun-2023.    
Drawing no. 337 PL 108(Proposed Roof Plan) Dated 19-Jun-2023.  
Arboricultural Report, Tree Constraints Plan & Impact Assessment Report Date:16 June 2023
Design and Access Statement Dated 19.06.2023

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Noise Levels - Expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes), from the new mechanical 2 No. AC Units - air conditioning shall not exceed LA90-10bB at the boundary with no.122 Home Park Road and  any residential property. 

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, DM D3 & DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 5 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
description: PROPOSED SINGLE STOREY PORCH EXTENSION TO THE FRONT ELEVATION AND SINGLE STOREY INFIL EXTENSION TO THE REAR ELEVATION AT GROUND FLOOR WITH NEW FLAT ROOF OVERHANG, ALONG WITH THE ADDITION OF X6NO. ROOF MOUNTED SOLAR PANELS TO EXISTING SOUTH FACING PITCH, ALLOWANCE FOR X2NO. AC UNITS CONCEALED WITHIN TIMBER LOUVRED ENCLOSURE TO THE NORTH SIDE ELEVATION AND A NEW INTEGRATED BIN AND BICYCLE STORE TO THE FRONT GARDEN OF 124 HOME PARK ROAD.
